newsitem.title: USA: 400-pound pimp tips scales of justice.
newsitem.headline: 400-pound pimp tips scales of justice.

text.p: The scales of justice needed reinforcement when a a 400-pound admitted pimp faced sentencing in Manhattan Supreme Court.

Robert York, 49, had to be hoisted by a crane onto a specially fitted gurney and taken up a freight elevator to the 15th floor courtroom for his sentencing before Manhattan Supreme Court Justice Rena Uviller.

Prosecutors on Thursday said York, accused of running a prostitution ring from his Manhattan apartment, was sentenced to nine months in jail. He had faced a seven-year prison term for promoting prostitution before confessing and pleading guilty to running a prostitution ring.
York, who is nicknamed "Fat Cat", was sentenced late on Wednesday after the Corrections Department inadvertently produced him in court a day earlier than scheduled.
York was brought to the courthouse steps in a huge truck. It took several officers about 15 minutes to secure him to the oversized chair.
"The judge decided that because of the hassle of getting him in and out of the courthouse, she went ahead and sentenced him Wednesday," a district attorney's spokeman said.

A paraplegic as the result of a back injury, York has been confined to the hospital unit at the Rikers Island jail since his arrest in January. Detectives said he had a stable of young girls including a teenager working for him.
